comment: Only one way to describe this professor, horrible.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Lois is knowledgeable but often came across as a know-it-all, which made asking questions feel intimidating. The workload was intense for just one credit hour, with high expectations and limited teaching or feedback. I recommend taking this course with someone else and suggest the department increase the credit hours to match the effort.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I would not recommend Lois as she is a novice teacher, she knows her stuff but doesn't do well teaching it. She could care less if you pass, she does not care about her students at all! She is very late in getting assignments back to you. She does grade students she's friendly with on a MUCH lighter scale. Wouldn't take her even for free.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Graded by few things

comment: The content itself isn't difficult, but she sets up the class so you effectively have to review the content daily so you don't forget anything and fail one of the numerous pop quizzes she likes to throw out which affect your grade way too much for what they are. She's a good lecturer overall and wants you to succeed, but the class can be a pain.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Caring

comment: The class wasn't that hard or didn't have to be. It was just disorganized and poorly planned. Start the semester well after the midterm content gets harder. Combined with pop quizzes worth 20% of your grade, hw, and a major group project, it becomes hard to manage and unpredictable. Like I was struggling in this class more than calc 2.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I mean do you even have a choice? Jesus i almost had a million strokes trying to keep up with this class. LOTS AND LOTS of homework, readings and u could barely even keep up sometimes. DO EXTREMELY GOOD ON UR FINAL PROJECT if you wanna pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: This class was an experience, I had her for IET 1000L. This was an online class so every week we had to sit on Microsoft Teams for almost two hours so imagine that. Then the exams are all lockdown with a webcam and she makes the questions confusing on purpose. She is also a very strict grader, meaning your assignment has to be how she expects it.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: hey lois
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: You must study everyday in this course. Grades tough on everything & takes a while to put in grades. She is helpful when you meet with her via micro teams, but makes students feel like they do not care about the material when they do not understand something or got a question wrong. All quizzes & tests require lockdown browser, timer moves quickly.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Be prepared to teach yourself & take quizzes with only 30 min allowed on lockdown browser (timer moves quickly). Some quizzes & tests are open book & some are not so be prepared to study like there is no tomorrow. Be prepared to email this instructor questions about the assignments & get no response. Be prepared to see confusing questions on tests.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Jordan is a fantastic teacher. She requires far toooo much homework. Some of these homeworks she will pop quiz you on. She offers extra credit. Test's are very hard and multiple choice, so no partial credit. She is organized and a great lecturer, but don't take her if you want an easy A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: She is the best professor I have ever had. She is very knowledgable about everything related to statistics. BEST I'VE EVER HAD!!! Please take her!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: I took Dr. Jordan for ISYE 3600 & 3150. She makes you work hard but wants you to exceed. If you ask for help, she will gladly do so. Her classes have really stuck with me, unlike others. Be prepared to work but learn. The textbook is definitely needed for both. I did every example in the back for 3600 and read every chapter for 3150. Got A's.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: This class is hard and Dr. Jordan assigns a lot of homework. But overall, shes a solid choice and you will definitely learn a lot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is a great professor. She knows so much about what she is teaching. Take her and you won't regret it. She makes sure you pass her class with a good grade because she does give a lot of extra credit and her exams are not difficult if you pay attention in the lecture. She is simply great!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Unfortunately not a great teacher. First you have to take the quiz, THEN she posts the lecture, and last you do a homework assignment, order is mixed up. And her quizzes arent just hard, theyre random and ask about irrelevant passing details in the book that have nothing to do with the concept*most* people dropped the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: I'm not going to lie, this class is difficult and a lot of work. Though, Professor Jordan is very knowledgeable and will be there if you need any kind of help at all. I know, her reviews are controversial; but if you put the time, do the work, and reach out if need be you will be fine.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. Jordan is not a good prof. In the lectures she rambles on and makes it hard to write notes your going to have to basically teach yourself with the book. The average for the quiz's and test where all failing. There is a group project which is very tedious. She is very aggressive as well. Would only take her again if she is the only prof.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Jordan is a fantastic professor. Her lectures are straightforward, and she goes through many relevant example problems during class. I did not find her tests to be difficult or unfair. Statistics is a tough subject - if you do not attend her lectures or do practice problems, you will not pass. Pay attention, study, and you will be just fine!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: My advice, do NOT take Dr. Jordan. She times the hw for 30 min (5-6 stats problems) and won't change it when asked. She is super intense about stats and makes you feel stupid for not knowing the answer immediately. Also only gives partial credit for math mistakes even if you get 3/4 parts of the problem right, you lose all 15 points of the question

She isn't bad, but I get annoyed that she has timed homework, but when you bring it up to her she'll change and say its a quiz. That is not how it is labeled. You have to finish the homework within that time, if you do not you will receive a 0 on homework. I do notice she tends to favor the guys over the girls. Good Luck!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: JUST TALKS TOO MUCH!!! She takes forever to get to the point and makes class boring. She gives essay exams which are subjective, so if you dont write what she wants you dont do well. She gives online quizzes that help and a team research paper, honestly she just is not a fair grader and wants you to be exact with your words.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader
